content.question: Which of the following statements best describes the time it takes for the two types of radiation from the supernova to reach Earth?

choices.label: The two types of radiation reach Earth at approximately the same time, within a few seconds of the supernova explosion.
The two types of radiation reach Earth at approximately the same time, many years after the supernova explosion.
The two types of radiation reach Earth many years after the supernova explosion, but the visible radiation arrives first due to its shorter wavelength.

The two types of radiation reach Earth many years after the supernova explosion, but the <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">x</mi></math>-ray radiation arrives first due to its shorter wavelength.

content.answer: The two types of radiation reach Earth at approximately the same time, many years after the supernova explosion.
